item.title: Lens Flare ?or other effect like FakeFactoryCM12?
item.dc:creator: myzombiekillerz
item.description:
[quote=“jerrw1234”]
I think Lens Flare would make the game more cinematic
Some people think that is annoying but will it possible in Black Mesa?
(with using Source sharder editor by biohazardpro)

i found out how to add lens flares in black mesa!

i modded the sprites to show flares, when you add a file into the BMS file, it overwrites ANYTHING in-game that uses HL2 sound, models, textures ect. well all i did was overwrite the sprite files to lens flare pictures and it worked!

here is a picture using it for proof: https://www.dropbox.com/s/jascb1q6vg2tven/BLACKMESAFLARE_000001.jpeg

here is the download: https://www.dropbox.com/s/g7xchfm8ebv2gw3/BMS_LENS_FLARES.zip

just follow the instructions and they will work.

the only issue i saw using these is that sometimes the flare does not line up perfectly with the light source, but it is pretty accurate

have fun you all!

(by the way, i found this before i made the modification, and decided to research some, and i found the sprites for the lights, they are called “Glow” and are in “GAMENAMEHERE\materials\sprites” in the Half Life 2 Folders.

if you don’t know what i am talking about, it may be I did the research and know how to use and mod source.

OK BYE NOW YOU ALL TRY OUT MY MOD OR YOU DIE

item.title: Lens Flare ?or other effect like FakeFactoryCM12?
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
You’re asking for a pummeling. Lens flare is pretty universally hated because it’s generally considered to be distracting and intrusive.

I sort of agree with you though, I always like seeing a bit of consistent visual noise in the form of film grain or lens flare.

It makes more sense with Gordon than any other game that uses the effect though. Lots of games that do lens flare and dirt have main characters that don’t wear glasses or helmets.
